Metadata: Human and organizational errors in loading and discharge operations at marine terminals

The purpose of this project is to study the occurence and then be able to minimize the likelihood of human error in one specific area of the marine industry: spills in California waters during tanker loading and discharging operations of petrochemicals at marine terminals. The paper describes tanker loading and discharge operations in general; and the individual, system, environmental, organizational and procedural factors that go into increasing the probability of spill incidents.
